snippet: The E.P.A. has proposed new regulations that could prolong use of the gasoline-powered internal combustion engine in cars, delaying the acceptance of alternatives.
abstract: News analysis notes that Environmental Protection Agency has proposed new regulations that could prolong use of gasoline-powered internal combustion engines in cars, delaying acceptance of alternative-fuel vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The E.P.A. has proposed new regulations that could prolong use of the gasoline-powered internal combustion engine in cars, delaying the acceptance of alternatives.

headline.main: Emissions Rules Put Alternative-Fuel Vehicles in a Bind
headline.print_headline: Emissions Rules Put Alternative-Fuel Vehicles in a Bind
